English (United States)(en-US): He was a circular man in an otherwise triangular family.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 세모난 가족들 사이의 동그란 사람.

English (United States)(en-US): His face had an evident hole in it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얼굴엔 언제부터인가 구멍이 뻥 뚫려 있었나 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): So his goal was to make marbles.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 그는 구슬을 만드는 일을 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): It was not an easy goal to achieve. His marble had to fit perfectly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 쉬운 일은 아니었지. 완벽하게 꼭 들어맞는 구슬이어야만 했으니.

English (United States)(en-US): He clung to the task. Night and day, relentless and endless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 집착적으로 매달렸어. 밤낮없이 도리없이 기약없이 매진했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Finally, he did it but…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마침내, 만들어 냈지만...

English (United States)(en-US): Alas.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 에구.

English (United States)(en-US): In his disappointment, he went down a different path. He started to look for love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 낙심한 그는 다른 방법을 찾았지. 사랑을 찾아다니기로 한 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): “If you love me, give me your candy.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑하면 사탕을 줘.’

English (United States)(en-US): “If you love me, give me your eyeball.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑하면 눈알을 줘.’

English (United States)(en-US): “If you love me, give me your round heart.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑하면 너의 동그란 심장을 줘.’

English (United States)(en-US): But it was not easy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러나 녹록지 않았지.

English (United States)(en-US): “Even your heart doesn’t fit my hole. You never really loved me, did you?”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘네 심장조차 나의 구멍에 딱 맞지 않잖아. 그럼 너는 날 사랑하지 않는 거야.’

English (United States)(en-US): Devastated, he left.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실연의 아픔에 젖은 채 그는 떠났어.

English (United States)(en-US): Now stuck in his own circular trap, he greedily swallowed all the circles of the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 그는 그만의 동그란 공백에 갇혀, 탐욕스럽게 세상의 모든 동그라미들을 삼켰어.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps he thought at least one must fit. What he radiated was,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐 하나는 들어맞을 수도 있겠다는 생각이었을까. 그런 그에게서 느껴지는 것은

English (United States)(en-US): Blank empathy. Engorged greed. Desperate hunger.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공허한 연민. 비대한 욕심. 처절한 허기.

English (United States)(en-US): One day, he stood and stared at the circular sun.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어느 날 그는 세상의 끝에 서서 동그란 태양을 바라보았어.

English (United States)(en-US): To dare… consume it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 태양을 삼키기 위해서.

English (United States)(en-US): After he was burned to the ground, all that was left of his fixation was—
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 육체가 분신하다 녹아내리고 난 후, 그 자리에 집념의 산물만이 남았어.

English (United States)(en-US): an empty hole.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오직 텅 빈 구멍만이.
